titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Virginia Jahn Peterson Collection MC.328
titlestmt.author: Stacey Flatt

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-14 08:47:05 -0500.

did.abstract: Virginia Jahn Peterson was a high school teacher who graduated from the New York University School of Education in 1944. This collection contains materials related to her time as a student at the New York University School of Education during the 1940s and as an alumna in the 1970s and 1980s. The collection includes a 1944 commencement ceremony program, class yearbook, NYU felt pennant and pin, and two issues of NYU Alumni publications.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Gayjone Carroll, May 2019; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.087.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Virginia Jahn Peterson (1922-1997) was a high school teacher and national speed skating champaion. She graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree from the NYU School of Education in 1944.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Virginia Jahn Peterson Collection; MC 328; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in acid-free folders and a box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials related to Virginia Jahn Peterson's time as a student at the New York University School of Education during the 1940s and as an alumna. The collection includes a 1944 commencement ceremony program, class yearbook, NYU felt pennant and pin, and two issues of NYU Alumni publications.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository.
